pizdyuk.market.portfolio module¶

class pizdyuk.market.portfolio.Portfolio(user_id, portfolio_members=None)[source]¶

Bases: market.core.MarketObjectBase

Class to represet a portfolio

add_position(symbol, price, date, amount)[source]¶

Tries to add a position to the portfolio. Will update or create a portfolio member depending on whether it exists or not.

Args: symbol (str) - Stock symbol price (float) - current Stock price date (datetime) - current (simulated) date amount (int) - the size of the position to add

get_object_info()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary representing the object’s information

get_position_size(symbol)[source]¶

Returns the position size of the stock with the provided symbol.

Args: symbol (str) - Stock symbol

has_member(symbol)[source]¶

Returns true if a stock with symbol exists

Args: symbol (str) - Stock symbol

remove_position(symbol, price, date, amount)[source]¶

Tries to remove a position from the portfolio.

Args: symbol (str) - Stock symbol price (float) - current Stock price date (datetime) - current (simulated) date amount (int) - the size of the position to add

update()[source]¶

Calls update on each of its portfolio members

Increases user balance by specified amount

Args: amount (int) - amount to increase user balance by.

add_position(symbol, amount)[source]¶

Adds specified position if possible.

Args: symbol (str) - Stock symbol to add amount (int) - position size to add

A getter function for user’s balance

Returns True if a position can be added

Args: symbol (str) - Stock symbol to add amount (int) - position size to add
